Episode 2,zusammen mit Episode 1 sind gute Fortsetzungen zu Halflife 2.Hat echt Spa√ü gemacht,das zu spielen.Manchmal war es zwar bisschen anstrengend,aber das tut dem Ganzen keinen Abruch ^^ Jetzt warte ich auf Halflife 3.

AMAZING! Can't wait for Episode Three/Half Life 3

This is where the franchise really change. Action gets faster and harder than HL2, and it starts to follow closer the more modern trend of being more story driven. While HL2 and Ep One were more action driven and had little dialogue, Ep Two has major story turns and explains way more about what's going on than both previous games combined.

If you like Half Life, I recommend you buy this one!

If Episode 1 was a great mini-sequel to Half-Life 2, Episode 2 is even better. It has a greater variety and atmosphere, focusing on outdoor settings, like caves and forests. It's also longer, especially if you're hunting all achievements. The graphics and music are about the same, lacking some innovation there. And of course, it ends in a cliffhanger that is still unsolved to this date. Another easy recommendation.
Want more Half-Life 2? Here yo go.

I now understand why so many people want Half Life 3. Definetly one of the best game series I've ever played. With lovable and memorable characters to Fast paced action and brilliant little puzzles the entire way through the game. And it definetly rewards you for exploring. From the ant lion nests to the strider assault it's an amazing game.

An excellent game with creative & fun gameplay. The story is great, despite it having a cliffhanger that's never gonna be followed-up.
[b] Definitely recommended. [b]

la continuacion del anterior episodio y en mi opinion una mejora en varios aspectos al episodio 1,en este juego si que hay nueva variedad de escenarios como el bosque,las minas abandonadas,el nido de larbas,etc.Cosa de la que me quejaba en el episodio 1 ya que pasas practicamente todo el juego en ciudad 17 y eso no es nada nuevo por lo cual puede que la exploracion resulte mucho mas placentera en este episodio,ya que practicamente todo el tiempo estas en lugares nunca antes vistos.De la historia ya todos saben que acaba con un corte severo el cual parece que jamas sera continuado a no ser que con la salida de source 2 se anuncie half life 3 o ep 3.En lo personal este episodio es en muchos aspectos superior a su antecesor,la historia toma varios giros y ademas tiene sus partes epicas que no me resultaron tan epicas como las del half life 2 original pero siguen siendo muy buenas,la duracion de este episodio es un poco mas larga que la del anterior pero no tanto,un juego que te acabas en menos de 3 horas asi que si vaz a jugar a este episodio debe ser porque realmente te interese saber que pasa despues o porque disfrutes de las mecanicas del juego ya la verdad es un poco caro para su duracion pero cada vez que hay rebajas cuesta poco mas de 1$,asi que ne definitiva esta es la gran continuacion de la saga y hasta donde llego esta y donde se quedo estancada pero aun asi es un juego que vale realmente la pena

Few games immerse you in the adventure and characters like this one, despite its short length. This is an amazing ride.

[u][b]Half-Life 2: Episode Two[/b] is a first-person shooter video game, the second episode in a series of sequels to the 2004 Half-Life 2.[/u]
Compared to HL2 and HL2 EP1, this is my favourite. Episode starts exactly after EP1. This time, main characters escaped City 17 with train and crashed. The main goal is to reach White Forest, bring data and launch rocket to destroy Combine portal...

[u][b]VERDICT[/b][/u]

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
- Great story.
- Excellent voice acting.
- Great characters.
- Awesome music.
- This time, better vehicle missions.
- A new few enemies.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
- Still no new weapons.

[h1][u][b]9.5/10[/b][/u][/h1]

Now... I don't know what to say about this. The ending and credits music is still leaving me depressed. Gameplay and everything was a lot better than Episode One, so that's that.

The huuuuge huge issue is, [b]there is no sequel.[/b] There are still tons of unanswered questions that need to be thoroughly explained in this game - neither of the episodes really managed to present it well but rather added more Q than A. Actually, Episode Two was very well put with rhythmic, steady plotline if you think about it. But that can only be said if there were sequels to this game that takes the seeds of the game and expand it to maximum potential. Because this episode probably leaves you curious and dying2no a lot more than the predecessors, or even any games out there.

Unfortunately, with the exception of our very last hope with the source engine 2.0, Valve will most likely not going to make any sequels to this game because there simply is no reason to.

Valve just doesn't realize how brutal it is to the fans who have waited literally a decade and not finish an immensely story-rich game with TONS of unanswered questions dragged alone in the back, not to mention the cliffhanger of this episode's ending as well. They're scared of causing Armageddon if the game didn't happen to be what the fans expected, but that shit didn't happen at all when they made Half Life 2. As long as they make sure they can keep the potentials of HL2 and build onto it with new engine's capabilities and whatnot, it's perfect. After all the successful sequels/remakes they've made on many great games they should feel confident at this point.

If you just want to buy this game for gunplay etc, go a head.

:(
